content: baby socks worsted/dk version designed by kate atherley top down plain and simple socks but sized for quick knitting and extreme cuteness an excellent emergency baby gift or just a nice way to use up some leftovers suitable for knitters with experience working in the round but the pattern is written to be easy enough for a first pair of socks written for dpns magic loop or 2 circulars use which you prefer materials dk/worsted weight yarn that knits to gauge less than 50 65 75 yds 4mm/us#6 needles for small circumference in the round dpns 1 long circular or 2 short circulars removable stitch marker size & finished measurements size newborn 6 months 9-12 months foot circumference 4 25 4 75 5 25 inches foot length 3 5 4 5 inches gauge 22 sts and 28 rounds = 4 inches in stockinette stitch stitch gauge is important round gauge less so glossary k tbl knit the st through the back loop sl 1 slip the next stitch as if to purl ssk slip next two sts one-by-one as if to knit insert tip of left needle into the fronts of these two stitches from left to right and knit them together pattern © kate atherley 2014 for personal use only www kateatherley com page 1 photos courtesy jesie ostermiller method cuff and leg notes & tips cast on 24 26 30 sts distribute across needles as  it s easiest to work the ribbing if you make sure each you prefer and join for working in the round ribbing needle has an even number of stitches round k1 p1 around  there s no need to place a marker keep track of the start of the round by watching your yarn tails when the work ribbing as set for 2 5 3 3 inches working yarn lines up with the cast-on tail you re at the start of the round if you do want to use a marker wait until you ve knitted a couple of rounds & place a removable stitch marker in the fabric near the tail heel flap row 1 rs k12 13 15 sts turn the remaining 12 13 15 sts will be held and used later for the instep slip them to a single needle row 2 ws sl 1 p11 12 14 turn row 3 sl 1 k11 12 14 turn row 4 sl 1 p11 12 14 turn repeat the last row 3 & 4 3 4 5 more times until 10 12 14 row total have been worked rs is facing heel turn row 1 rs k8 9 10 ssk turn note and tips row 2 ws sl 1 p4 5 5 p2tog turn  when working the heel turn row there will be row 3 sl 1 k4 5 5 ssk turn stitches left over at the end of the row this is normal each decrease uses up one of the
